title: The Phonograph: When Music Became Permanent
description: One-minute skill: The Phonograph: When Music Became Permanent.

hook.text: Before 1877, music existed only in the moment. Edison's phonograph captured sound for the first time.

buildup.text: For all of human history, music disappeared as soon as it was played. Recording technology ended that â€” forever.

discovery.text: Suddenly, a performance could be heard by millions who weren't present. Music became a product, not just an experience.

twist.text: John Philip Sousa warned that recordings would destroy live music.

climax.text: Recording changed how music was MADE â€” shorter songs (to fit discs), studio effects, multitrack layering.

punchline.text: Music was always temporary. One invention made it eternal.

quiz.question: How did recording technology change how music was composed?
options: Songs became shorter to fit discs, and studio effects became part of composition
